member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyHealthState
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the health state of the policy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyHealthState.Unknown
member.summary: The state of the policy is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyHealthState.Critical
member.summary: The policy is in a critical state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyHealthState.Healthy
member.summary: The policy is in a healthy state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyHealthState.NoPolicy
member.summary: The policy does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the security context used by a procedure. These procedures are activated by a service queue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.Owner
member.summary: The activated procedure is executed with the security context of the object owner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.ExecuteAsUser
member.summary: The activated procedure is executed with the security context of a specified user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.Self
member.summary: Self.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the addition options when modifying an assembly. The values are bit flag values, and they can be combined by adding the values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions.None
member.summary: No alter options are specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions.NoChecks
member.summary: The assembly data will not be checked for consistency before or after the Alter operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the access rights for an assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.Safe
member.summary: Value = 1. Only safe access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.External
member.summary: Value = 2. External access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.Unrestricted
member.summary: Value = 3. Unrestricted access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify an encryption algorithm used on an asymmetric key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm.CryptographicProviderDefined
member.summary: Value = 3. A cryptographic provider is used to encrypt the asymmetric key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm.Rsa512
member.summary: Value = 0. 512-bit RSA encryption algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm.Rsa1024
member.summary: Value = 1. 1024-bit RSA encryption algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm.Rsa2048
member.summary: Value = 2. 2048-bit RSA encryption algorithm.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType
member.summary: Specifies the type of action for SQL Server audit events.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ApplicationRoleChangePasswordGroup
member.summary: The ApplicationRoleChangePasswordGroup action occurs whenever a password is changed for an application role.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.AuditChangeGroup
member.summary: The AuditChangeGroup action occurs whenever any audit or audit specification is created, modified, or deleted. Any change to an audit is audited in the same audit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.BackupRestoreGroup
member.summary: The BackupRestoreGroup action occurs whenever a backup or restore operation is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.BrokerLoginGroup
member.summary: The BrokerLoginGroup action occurs when any Service Broker login operation is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseChangeGroup action occurs when a database is created, altered, or dropped. At the server scope, this action occurs whenever any database is created, altered, or dropped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseLogoutGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseLogoutGroup action type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseMirroringLoginGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseMirroringLoginGroup action occurs when any database mirroring operation is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseObjectAccessGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseObjectAccessGroup action occurs whenever database objects are accessed, such as certificates and asymmetric keys. At the server scope, this action occurs for any object accessed in any database. This can lead to very large audit records.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseObjectChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseObjectChangeGroup action occurs when a CREATE, ALTER, or DROP statement is executed on database objects such as schemas. At the server scope, the action occurs whenever any database object is created, altered, or dropped. This can lead to very large quantities of audit records.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseObjectOwnershipChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseObjectOwnershipChangeGroup action occurs when a change of owner for objects within the database scope occurs. At the server scope, this action occurs for any object ownership change on any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseObjectPermissionChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseObjectPermissionChangeGroup action occurs when a GRANT, REVOKE, or DENY statement is issued for database objects, such as assemblies or schemas. At the server scope, this action occurs for any object permission change for any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseOperationGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseOperationGroup action occurs when operation in a database such as checkpoint or subscribe query notification occur. At the server scope, this action occurs on any database action on any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseOwnershipChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseOwnershipChangeGroup action occurs when the ALTER AUTHORIZATION statement is used to change the owner of a database and the permissions required to do that are checked. At the server scope, this action occurs for any database ownership change on any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabasePermissionChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabasePermissionChangeGroup action occurs whenever a GRANT, REVOKE, or DENY statement is issued for a statement permission by any user within the scope of the database. At the server scope, this action occurs for any database permission change for any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabasePrincipalChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabasePrincipalChangeGroup action occurs when principals such as users, are created, altered, or dropped from a database. At the server scope, this action occurs whenever any database principals are created, altered, or dropped from any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabasePrincipalImpersonationGroup
member.summary: The DatabasePrincipalImpersonationGroup action occurs when there is an impersonation within the database scope, such as the EXECUTE AS statement executed on a user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DatabaseRoleMemberChangeGroup
member.summary: The DatabaseRoleMemberChangeGroup action occurs whenever a login is added to or removed from a database role. This action is generated by the sp_addrolemember, sp_changegroup, and sp_droprolemember stored procedures. At the server scope, it is generated for any database role member change to any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.DbccGroup
member.summary: The DbccGroup action occurs whenever a DBCC command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Delete
member.summary: The Delete action occurs whenever a DELETE command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Execute
member.summary: The Execute action occurs whenever an EXECUTE command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.FailedDatabaseAuthenticationGroup
member.summary: The FailedDatabaseAuthenticationGroup action type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.FailedLoginGroup
member.summary: The FailedLoginGroup action indicates that a user tried to log in to the instance of SQL Server and failed. Events in this class are fired by new connections or connection that are reused from the connection pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.FullTextGroup
member.summary: The FulltextGroup action indicates that there is a named pipe connection between the SQL Full-text Filter Daemon Launcher/Filter Daemon and the instance of SQL Server. Events in this class are fired by success or failure of new connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Insert
member.summary: The Insert action occurs whenever an INSERT command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.LoginChangePasswordGroup
member.summary: The LoginChangePasswordGroup action occurs whenever a login password is changed by using the ALTER LOGIN or the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.LogoutGroup
member.summary: The LogoutGroup action indicates that a user has logged out of the instance of SQL Server. Events in this class are fired by new connections or connections that are reused from the connection pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Receive
member.summary: The Receive action occurs whenever a RECEIVE command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.References
member.summary: The References action occurs whenever a REFERENCES permission is checked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SchemaObjectAccessGroup
member.summary: The SchemaObjectAccessGroup action occurs when a schema object is accessed. At the server scope, this action occurs whenever any schema object is accessed on any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SchemaObjectChangeGroup
member.summary: The SchemaObjectChangeGroup action occurs when a CREATE, ALTER, or DROP statement is issued on schema objects, such as tables or views. At the server scope, this action occurs whenever any schema of any database object changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SchemaObjectOwnershipChangeGroup
member.summary: The SchemaObjectOwnershipChangeGroup action occurs when the permissions to change the owner of schema object, such as a table or a view, are selected. This action occurs when the ALTER AUTHORIZATION statement is used to assign an owner to an object. At the server scope, this action occurs for any schema ownership change for any database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SchemaObjectPermissionChangeGroup
member.summary: The SchemaObjectPermissionChangeGroup action occurs whenever a GRANT, REVOKE, or DENY statement is issued on a schema object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Select
member.summary: The Select action occurs whenever a SELECT command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerObjectChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerObjectChangeGroup action occurs when a CREATE, ALTER, or DROP statement is issued for any server object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerObjectOwnershipChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerObjectOwnershipChangeGroup action occurs when the owner is changed for objects in the server scope.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerObjectPermissionChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerObjectPermissionChangeGroup action occurs whenever a GRANT, REVOKE, or DENY statement is issued for a server object permission by any user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerOperationGroup
member.summary: The ServerOperationGroup action occurs when security audit operations, such as altering settings, resources, external access, or authorization, are used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerPermissionChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerPermissionChangeGroup action occurs when a GRANT, REVOKE, or DENY statement is issued for permission in the server scope, such as creating a login.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerPrincipalChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerPrincipalChangeGroup action occurs when server principals are created, altered, or dropped. This action is generated by the sp_defaultdb, sp_defaultlanguage stored procedures, and the ALTER LOGIN statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerPrincipalImpersonationGroup
member.summary: The ServerPrincipalImpersonationGroup action occurs when there is an impersonation within the server scope, such as an EXECUTE AS statement executed on a login.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerRoleMemberChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerRoleMemberChangeGroup action occurs whenever a login is added or removed from a fixed server role. This action is generated by sp_addsrvrole and sp_dropsrvrolemember stored procedures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.ServerStateChangeGroup
member.summary: The ServerStateChangeGroup action occurs when the SQL Server service is modified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SuccessfulDatabaseAuthenticationGroup
member.summary: The SuccessfulDatabaseAuthenticationGroup action type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.SuccessfulLoginGroup
member.summary: The SuccessfulLoginGroup action indicates that a user has successfully logged in to the instance of SQL Server. Events in this class are fired by new connections or by connections that are reused from the connection pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.TraceChangeGroup
member.summary: The TraceChangeGroup action occurs whenever a Trace operation is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.Update
member.summary: The Update action occurs whenever an UPDATE command is issued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.UserChangePasswordGroup
member.summary: The UserChangePasswordGroup action type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditActionType.UserDefinedAuditGroup
member.summary: The UserDefinedAuditGroup action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditDestinationType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the destination, to which the results of a SQL Server Audit are sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditDestinationType.File
member.summary: A file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditDestinationType.SecurityLog
member.summary: Windows Security event log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditDestinationType.ApplicationLog
member.summary: The Windows Application event log.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditFileSizeUnit
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the unit that specifies the size of the audit file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditFileSizeUnit.Mb
member.summary: The audit file size is specified in MB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditFileSizeUnit.Gb
member.summary: The audit file size is specified in GB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditFileSizeUnit.Tb
member.summary: The audit file size is specified in terabytes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the SQL Server audit level setting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.Success
member.summary: Audits successful login attempts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.Failure
member.summary: Audits failed login attempts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.All
member.summary: Audits both successful and failed login attempts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditStatusType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the status of the audit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditStatusType.Started
member.summary: The audit has started.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditStatusType.Stopped
member.summary: The audit has stopped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditStatusType.Failed
member.summary: The audit has failed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuthenticationType
member.summary: Specifies the Sql server authentication type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuthenticationType.None
member.summary: The none authentication type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuthenticationType.Instance
member.summary: The instance authentication type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuthenticationType.Database
member.summary: The database authentication type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuthenticationType.Windows
member.summary: The windows authentication type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState
member.summary: Represents the current state of the availability database synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState.NotSynchronizing
member.summary: The synchronization state is NotSynchronizing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState.Synchronizing
member.summary: The synchronization state is Synchronizing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState.Synchronized
member.summary: The database replica is synchronized with the primary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState.Reverting
member.summary: The database replica is reverting after a failover.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityDatabaseSynchronizationState.Initializing
member.summary: The database replica is initializing after a failover.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference
member.summary: Specifies how replicas in the primary role are treated in the evaluation to pick the desired replica to perform a backup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.Primary
member.summary: Backups occur only on the primary replica, wherever it is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.SecondaryOnly
member.summary: Backups occur only on the secondary replicas. If no secondary replicas are online, backup will not be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.Secondary
member.summary: Backups occur on the secondary replicas, except when the primary replica is the only replica online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.None
member.summary: No preference is stated for backup on replicas based on its current role. Only BackupPriority and online/connected states will be considered for replica choice.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.Unknown
member.summary: The desired replica to perform a backup is unknown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the different conditions that can trigger an automatic failover in Availability Group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnServerDown
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when the SQL Server service is down.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnServerUnresponsive
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when SQL Server is down or unresponsive, or when the Availability Group’s primary replica is in a failed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnCriticalServerErrors
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a critical server error occurs. If no setting for an Availability Group is specified, this is the default value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnModerateServerErrors
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a moderate server error occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnAnyQualifiedFailureCondition
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a qualifying failure condition occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.Unknown
member.summary: The condition level is unknown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState
member.summary: Specifies the state of the Availability Group Listener IP Address.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState.Offline
member.summary: Availability Group Listener IP resources is offline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState.Online
member.summary: Availability Group Listener IP resources is online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState.OnlinePending
member.summary: Availability Group Listener IP resources is online pending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState.Failure
member.summary: Availability Group Listener IP resources failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupListenerIPState.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown state for Availability Group Listener IP resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState
member.summary: Specifies a rollup of the synchronization states of the availability replicas in the availability group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState.NoneSynchronizing
member.summary: None of the availability replicas is synchronizing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState.PartiallySynchronizing
member.summary: At least one of the replicas is in “synchronizing” state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState.AllSynchronizing
member.summary: All of the replicas are in “synchronizing” state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState.AllSynchronized
member.summary: All of the replicas are in “synchronized” state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupRollupSynchronizationState.Unknown
member.summary: The synchronization state is unknown, this would be the case if the property is viewed on a secondary replica.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaAvailabilityMode
member.summary: Specifies the availability modes of Availability Replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaAvailabilityMode.AsynchronousCommit
member.summary: The availability mode is Asynchronous Commit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaAvailabilityMode.SynchronousCommit
member.summary: The availability mode is Synchronous Commit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaAvailabilityMode.Unknown
member.summary: The availability mode is unknown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInPrimaryRole
member.summary: Specifies the connection intent modes of an Availability Replica in primary role.

member.summary: The availability replica in primary role will allow all connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInPrimaryRole.AllowReadWriteConnections
member.summary: The availability replica in primary role will allow read/write connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInPrimaryRole.Unknown
member.summary: The connection is unknown.

member.summary: The availability replica in secondary role will not allow any connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInSecondaryRole.AllowReadIntentConnectionsOnly
member.summary: The availability replica in secondary role will allow only read-intent connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInSecondaryRole.AllowAllConnections
member.summary: The availability replica in secondary role will allow all connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionModeInSecondaryRole.Unknown
member.summary: The connection in the availability replica is unknown.

member.summary: Represents the current availability replica connection state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionState.Disconnected

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionState.Connected
member.summary: The connection state is Connected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaConnectionState.Unknown
member.summary: The connection state is Unknown.

member.summary: Specifies the failover modes of Availability Replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaFailoverMode.Automatic
member.summary: The failover mode is automatic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaFailoverMode.Manual
member.summary: The failover mode is manual.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaFailoverMode.Unknown
member.summary: The failover mode is unknown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaJoinState
member.summary: Specifies the availability replica join state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaJoinState.NotJoined
member.summary: The NotJoined state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaJoinState.JoinedStandaloneInstance
member.summary: The JoinedStandaloneInstance state for the availability replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaJoinState.JoinedFailoverClusterInstance
member.summary: The JoinedFailoverClusterInstance state for the availability replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaJoinState.Unknown

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState
member.summary: Specifies the state of the replica's readiness to process client requests for all databases replicas in the availability group residing on it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.PendingFailover
member.summary: A failover command is in progress, the replica cannot receive client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.Pending
member.summary: The replica is pending a switch to primary role. This is a transient state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.Online
member.summary: The replica is ready to client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.Offline
member.summary: The availability group currently has no primary, the replica cannot receive client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.Failed
member.summary: The replica is unable to communicate with the Windows cluster, the replica cannot receive client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.FailedNoQuorum
member.summary: The availability group has lost quorum, the replica cannot receive client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaOperationalState.Unknown
member.summary: The operational state of this replica is unknown, the availability replica object referes to a remote instance.

member.summary: The Role is Resolving.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRole.Primary
member.summary: The Role is Primary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRole.Secondary
member.summary: The Role is Secondary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRole.Unknown
member.summary: The Role is Unknown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupRecoveryState
member.summary: Specifies a rollup of the recovery state of all database replicas in the availability group that reside on this availability replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupRecoveryState.InProgress
member.summary: At least one of the database replicas' state is not online.

member.summary: All the database replicas' states are online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupRecoveryState.Unknown
member.summary: The recovery health state of this replica is unknown, the availability replica object referes to a remote instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupSynchronizationState.NotSynchronizing
member.summary: At least one database replica on is not synchronizing with the primary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupSynchronizationState.Synchronizing
member.summary: All database replicas are at least synchronizing with the primary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupSynchronizationState.Synchronized
member.summary: All database replicas are synchronized with the primary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityReplicaRollupSynchronizationState.Unknown
member.summary: The synchronization state of the replica is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Tape

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Unknown
member.summary: The device is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType.Differential

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the method used to populate a full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction.Full
member.summary: The entire catalog is fully populated. This causes all index data to be retrieved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction.Incremental
member.summary: The catalog is populated incrementally.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the status of the full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Idle
member.summary: Value = 0. No action is being performed on the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.CrawlinProgress
member.summary: Value = 1. Full-text index population is in progress for the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Paused
member.summary: Value = 2. Lack of available resources has caused an interruption.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Throttled
member.summary: Value = 3. The Microsoft Search service has paused the index population of the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Recovering
member.summary: Value = 4. The population of the referenced full-text catalog is resuming after an interruption.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Shutdown
member.summary: Value = 5. The referenced full-text catalog is being deleted or is otherwise inaccessible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Incremental
member.summary: Value = 6. Incremental index population is in progress for the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.UpdatingIndex
member.summary: Value = 7. The referenced full-text catalog is being assembled by the Search service. This is the final step in full-text catalog population.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.DiskFullPause
member.summary: Value = 8. The disk is paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Notification
member.summary: Value = 9. Progress of catalog population is being reported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.NSActivationState.EnablePending
member.summary: The component was in the Disabled state prior to being enables. This state indicates that the change has not yet been completed by the Notification Services engine. If the Notification Services engine is running on the server specified in the application definition, the state should change to Enabled with 30 seconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.NSActivationState.Enabled
member.summary: The component is configured to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.NSActivationState.DisablePending
member.summary: The component was in the Enabled state prior to being enabled. This state indicates that the change has not yet been completed by Notification Services engine. If the Notification Services engine is running on the server specified in the application definition, the state should change to Disabled within 30 seconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.NSActivationState.Disabled
member.summary: The component is not configured to run. When you first create an instance of Notification Services, all components are disabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the repair options that are used when checking data in a table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.None
member.summary: No repair options specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.AllErrorMessages
member.summary: Displays all reported errors per object. If it is not specified, 200 error messages are displayed for each object. The maximum is 1000.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.ExtendedLogicalChecks
member.summary: Starting with SQL Server 2008, performs logical consistency checks on an indexed view, XML indexes, and spatial indexes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.NoInformationMessages
member.summary: Specifies that no information messages will be displayed during the repair operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.TableLock
member.summary: Limits the checks that are performed. The database catalogs are not checked for consistency, and Service Broker data is not validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairOptions.EstimateOnly
member.summary: Requests the estimated amount of tempdb space that is required to run the CheckTables method. The actual database check is not performed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairStructure
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the type of repair options used when checking data in a table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairStructure.None
member.summary: No column checks are performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairStructure.PhysicalOnly
member.summary: Column-integrity checks are not performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RepairStructure.DataPurity
member.summary: Checks the table for column values that are not valid, or are out-of-range.

member.summary: Snapshot isolation is not currently in effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.SnapshotIsolationState.PendingOn
member.summary: Snapshot isolation is waiting to be enabled when all current transactions commit or roll back.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.CompletionAction
member.summary: The enumeration is a list of constant values that specify the circumstances when a job completes after which another action is executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.CompletionAction.Never
member.summary: Value = 0. The action is never executed regardless of the success or failure of the job step.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.CompletionAction.OnSuccess
member.summary: Value = 1. The action is only executed after the job step has completed with success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.CompletionAction.OnFailure
member.summary: Value = 2. The action is only executed after the job step has completed with failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.CompletionAction.Always
member.summary: Value = 3. The action is always executed regardless of the success or failure of the job step.

member.summary: The job or job step is waiting to be retried.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the method used to notify operators in an alert or a job. This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.None
member.summary: There is no notification method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.NotifyEmail
member.summary: The notification is sent by e-mail.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.Pager
member.summary: The notification is sent to a pager service by e-mail and the pager service send the message to the operator's pager.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.NetSend
member.summary: The notification is sent over the network as an instant message to a computer and the message is displayed on the screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.NotifyAll
member.summary: All three notification methods are used; e-mail, pager, and net send.

member.summary: The operating system runs with below-normal priority.

member.summary: The operating system runs with normal priority.

member.summary: When the referenced job step completes the job completes execution with a status of success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.StepCompletionAction.QuitWithFailure
member.summary: When the referenced job step completes the job completes execution with a status of failure.

member.summary: When the referenced job step completes the next job step is executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.StepCompletionAction.GoToStep

member.summary: The target server is operating normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.TargetServerStatus.SuspectedOffline
